intro: Antholyza labiata, commonly known as the redroot germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
